all_questions.question: What happens to the beam search candidate when the next word's score is calculated?
all_questions.context: You simply multiply the score of the prefix with the probability of the next word

all_questions.question: How does the score of the extended hypothesis compare to the beam search candidate?
all_questions.context: Your candidate is the prefix up to the current word and you compute the score of the extended hypothesis

all_questions.question: What is the result when you multiply the score of the prefix with the probability of the next word?
all_questions.context: And that gives you hypothesis one word longer.

all_questions.question: How does the beam search algorithm work in terms of adding new words to the hypothesis?
all_questions.context: You simply multiply the score of the prefix with the probability of the next word which comes after that

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of using beam search in natural language processing or machine learning?
all_questions.context: So what do you do with the beam search is that your candidate is the prefix up to the current word and you compute the score of the extended hypothesis.
